author: Megan Ellis
title: Relais & Châteaux's Cape Town offerings
text:
Relais & Châteaux's Cape Town offerings Article By: Megan Ellis Thu, 08 Oct 2015 2:34 PM Share Your Email The Cellars-Hohenort. Credit: Megan Ellis 
Relais & Châteaux boasts many fine hotels and villas under their collection. We were lucky enough to see what they have on offer in Cape Town and surrounds. 
On a rainy day we enjoyed the splendour of the different hotels and estates, getting a peek at the luxury on offer. 
Here's what we found... 
The Cellars-Hohenorts 
The Cellars-Hohenorts boasts the old-world feel of estates that are often seen around the Western Cape, but it also has luxury at its heart. 
The manor house is almost 100 years old and you can feel the history emanating from the architecture as you walk by. However the interiors are grand, and you would never realise the age of the buildings. 
Exquisite views sneak up on your as you walk around the estate, from lush greenery to rustic verandas. 
The lounges in the hotel are grand yet also snug. From the chubby cat snoozing on the couch to the warm fire heating up a cold day, you will feel like you're in one of the most comfortable places in the world. 
Of course, there is also the food. The Conservancy boasts an array of dishes which will satisfy almost any taste preferences.

Delaire Graff Estate 
Delaire Graff is as vast as it is elegant - the grape vines are visible from the hilltop to the edge of the estate and the views seem to go on forever. 
Everything about the wine estate seems larger than life - the high ceilings, the sprawling buildings and the giant artworks. 
Unfortunately we were unable to capture the beauty of the estate due to rain, but even that couldn't ruin our fun. 
Golf carts transport you around the estate, allowing you to take in the beauty with minimal effort. Of course, the estate also makes for a great setting for a leisurely walk. 
The wine cellar is accompanied by the Delaire Graff Restaurant, where you are able to enjoy wine and food pairings, as well as regular dining. 
The other restaurant, Indochine, is a feast for the eyes, with metal silhouettes of swallows gloriously adorning the ceiling. 
The estate even has several boutiques where you can shop for diamonds and clothing. 
The estate is a destination on its own and will keep you entertained and content. Meanwhile the accommodation seems to be the epitome of luxury and indulgence. 
Find out more about Delaire Graff here . 
Ellerman House 
Did you know that Ellerman House is one of the top five highest-rated boutique hotels in Africa for multi-millionaires? In fact, it came in second place . 
This is probably because of Ellerman House's refinement and uniqueness. 
No one would blame you if you thought Ellerman House was actually an exceptionally elegant art museum - the walls of the hotel are lined with beautiful artworks which have been expertly laid out to be viewed and enjoyed. Rooms themselves seem to be small art installations, but they're actually havens of luxury and amazing aesthetics. 
Even the rain couldn't put a damper on our short visit to Ellerman. While the hotel boasts beautiful views in a prime location in Camps Bay, the interiors are a sight by themselves. 
It seems like a place you could explore for hours, with interesting nooks and tucked-away rooms. 
You can see why multi-millionaires love this boutique hotel. 
You can read about Ellerman House on their site .
